name: MachineType
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Compute Engine.

First, install @google-cloud/compute with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/compute

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/computeâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var compute = require('@google-cloud/compute')();

Elsewhere

var compute = require('@google-cloud/compute')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/compute are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: MachineType
methods.description: A MachineType object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine machine type.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.exists
params.description: • Whether the machine type exists or not.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get a machine type if it exists.
